title: Water company sent to collections before bill is due?
question: My water was shut off on 12/21/10. I was given a "FINAL BILL" on the 1/5/2011 with a due date of 2/01/2011. I called them on the jan. 7th to confirm that I have until feb 1st 2011 to pay the bill before it goes to collection. Then today,(jan 19), I get a bill ,(dated jan. 11), from a collection agency for the water bill. How can they send my bill to collections when my due date is still 2 weeks away? I have been having problems with them. I told them I lost my job and if they could give me an extension and they said no. I asked if they could take of the late fees and or the $20 door hanger charge. They said no. Now if I want my water turned back on, I have to pay the balance. Open a new account, since they closed my account. $35 enrollment fee. and a $450 deposit.
answers:
A creditor can chose to send a bill to collections anytime - it's perfectly legal

Please don't try to convince a group of attorneys that your payment wasn't delinquent- you know perfectly well that when the service was cut off, you hadn't been making these payments!

Utilities are controlled by state laws, and state laws are posted on the website of your state. You may wish to review them so that you understand what they can do if you don't pay for the service when it is billed to you.

Hope this perspective helps!

It's not clear how much you owe them and for how long and if they turned off your water because of a longer owed debt, so this final bill might be besides the point. Payment for this final bill might not have been due when they sent it to collections, but past ones were, and late fees and door hanger fees, and were unpaid.
